title: Mumbai Police’s epic reply to Shobhaa De’s fat-shaming post, Twitter is elated
text:
Mumbai Police’s epic reply to Shobhaa De’s fat-shaming post, Twitter is elated Mumbai Police’s epic reply to Shobhaa De’s fat-shaming post, Twitter is elated Currently reading: Mumbai Police’s epic reply to Shobhaa De’s fat-shaming post, Twitter is elated #Shobhaa De , #Twitter , #Mumbai Police India TV Entertainment Desk, New Delhi [ Updated: 22 Feb 2017, 13:40:05] The controversial socialite and writer Shobhaa De is all over the news now and then for her infamous tweets. Recently, the lady fat-shamed a policeman on Twitter which didn’t go well with people, and now Mumbai Police has a befitting reply to Ms De’s “funny” post. 
The bestselling author tried to put her humour into action, and posted a picture of an obese policeman with a caption that read “Heavy police bandobast in the city today!” Heavy police bandobast in Mumbai today! pic.twitter.com/sY0H3xzXl3 — Shobhaa De (@DeShobhaa) February 21, 2017 
The Mumbai Police was quick to reply as they also took to Twitter and said, “We love puns too Ms. De but this one is totally misplaced. Uniform/official not ours. We expect better from responsible citizens like you.” We love puns too Ms De but this one is totally imisplaced. Uniform/official not ours. We expect better from responsible citizens like you. https://t.co/OcKOoHO5bX — Mumbai Police (@MumbaiPolice) February 21, 2017 
As soon as the police posted the tweet, a huge number of people responded and took to the micro-blogging site to express their utmost happiness. 
While the Twitteratis lauded the police, they didn’t spare Shobhaa De at all and spewed tons of criticisms against the socialite. 
Check out some interesting tweets Kudos @MumbaiPolice for standing up for dignity!Seems celebs look out for their own image but put down ors.About time people called it out — Amrita Bhinder (@amritabhinder) February 21, 2017 . @MumbaiPolice you can forgive her for not being a responsible citizen but you should charge her for Copying others Tweet. pic.twitter.com/PjNUI1z5pA — PhD in Bak !! (@Atheist_Krishna) February 21, 2017 @DeShobhaa if I zoom in the photo, I can see M.P. police written on his badge.Don't keep tweeting nonsense. N yes, it amount to body-shaming
